verses.roman:
dui pāye phoskā haila, tabu gelā prabhu-sthāne
bhikṣā kari' mahāprabhu kariyāchena viśrāme

synonyms: dui pāye—on the two soles; phoskā haila—there were blisters; tabu—still; gelā—came; prabhu-sthāne—to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; bhikṣā kari'-after finishing lunch; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kariyāchena viśrāme—was taking rest.
translation: Although the soles of both his feet were blistered because of the heat, he nevertheless went to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu. There he found that the Lord, having taken His lunch, was resting.
